titles.title: To amend title 39, United States Code, to make nonmailable any mail matter which bears on its face or on its envelope or outside cover or wrapper the Social Security account number of any individual.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Postal Service.

bill.summary: 7/20/2000--Introduced. Makes any mail matter that bears the social security account number of any individual on its face, envelope, outside cover, or wrapper (or through the envelope, cover, or wrapper of which such number is visible) nonmailable and requires its disposal as the Postal Service directs.
